text.section: All engineering documents prepared in connection with the alteration, construction, design, or repair of a building, structure, building engineering system and its components, machine, equipment, process, works, subsystem, project, public or private utility, or facility in the built or economic environment where the skills of a professional engineer are required, shall be signed, sealed, and dated by the professional engineer who prepared or approved the documents.

A professional engineer may perform design coordination for a project or portion of a project provided that the professional engineer:
holds a current license issued by the Board; and
has adequate experience in, and understanding of, achieving the purpose of the project or portion of the project being coordinated.
